findings.interpretation: The day side is warm but this temperature alone is not sufficient to prove a bare surface; intermediate temperatures are consistent with both atmosphere-bearing and bare-rock scenarios
Non-zero redistribution is favored, indicating that energy is being transported from day to night side beyond what would occur on an airless body
Planet appears very dark in thermal-energy balance fits, which constrains surface and atmospheric reflective properties

findings.metric: 15 um CO2 spectral band depth estimate
findings.interpretation: Spectral structure is consistent with atmospheric absorption signatures expected from CO2-rich atmospheric compositions
Atmosphere-bearing models better explain combined data products, providing statistical support for atmospheric presence

findings.metric: Preferred pressure scale in CO2-rich retrieval
findings.interpretation: Moderate-pressure atmosphere family remains plausible given current data, though pressure constraints are not definitive

controls_or_null_results.statement: A pure no-atmosphere model cannot simultaneously match both phase amplitude and spectral band behavior
O2-rich atmosphere cases are not fully ruled out by current data
Degeneracies between composition, clouds/hazes, and circulation assumptions remain significant
Joint constraints from phase curve and spectrum are stronger than either observable alone
Remaining degeneracies motivate broader wavelength coverage and repeated observations
